intro: Hapaline ellipticifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hapaline, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its elliptic-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream sides. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
